div1.p: Griffitts thanks Carter for her letter and enclosures about Henry Rose Carter.

div1.head: Letter from T. H. D. Griffitts to Mary Clayborne Carter, November 2, 1938
div1.opener:
IN REPLYING, ADDRESS THE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Henry R. Carter Memorial Laboratory
P. O. Box 547
Savannah, Georgia
November 2, 1938
Miss Mary C. Carter
Ashland
Virginia
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I find it difficult to express fully my appreciation for
your letter of October 28th and the enclosures relative to the
life of your brother, and my friend, Dr. Henry Rose Carter. Of
the many things in the notes which you have given me, I think
the episode with Uncle Isaac illustrates as well as anything
could the honesty of his soul and mind which was with him
throughout his life. I can picture the puzzled mind of young
Henry when the old negro pulled, in modern parlance, “a fast
one.”

I know that I shall not be able to do the subject full
justice but I will do my best and I will be pleased to send
you a copy or a reprint of the address.

Thanking you, and with best wishes for your health and
happiness, I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Thomas HD Griffitts Thomas H. D. Griffitts
Senior Surgeon
Medical Officer in Charge
THDG:f
P.S. I am sending you a photograph of Doctor Henry R. Carter, Jr.,
and myself, which was taken at the unveiling of the tablet dedi-
cating this malaria research laboratory to Doctor Henry R. Carter.
THDG
